trial_identification.studytitle: An observational, multicentre, non interventional programme to register patients diagnosed with neuroendocrine tumours (NETs) and monitor their patterns of care in Australian hospitals.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Neuroendocrine Tumour Non-interventional Patient Registry to monitor patterns of care in Australian Hospitals
trial_identification.trialacronym: SIGNETURe (Specialist Interest Group in Neuroendocrine Tumours Unique Registry)

interventions.interventions: Non-interventional. This study will capture how patients are treated in current clinical practice. There will be no change to current clinical practice. The duration of the study is open-ended but analyses will be ongoing throughout the study period.

primaryOutcome.outcome: To assess patterns of care in Australian Hospitals. A web-based database that will capture information obtained from medical records. The information will be used to assess the outcomes (disease progression rates/survival rates) in patients with neuroendocrine tumours and correlate this with the treatment regimens received.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Not defined. Data will be analysed on a periodic basis.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Incidence and Prevalence of Neuroendocrine Tumours in Australia. Web-based database will be able to record the number of patients in Australia with this disease, record the diagnosis rate of new patients and additional demographic information such as age, sex and race.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Not defined. Data will be analysed on a periodic basis.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Diagnosis of Neuroendocrine Tumour. Informed Consent Given.

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: C/- Dr Tim Price Queen Elizabeth Hospital 28 Woodville Road Woodville, SA 5011

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This registry will enhance the national medical research effort for improved patient outcomes in Australia through improved diagnosis, reporting and management of NETs by collaboration among specialist oncologists, cancer registries and trialists at state and national levels.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Royal Adelaide Hospital Human Research Ethics Committee (HREC)
ethicscommitee.ethicaddress: Royal Adelaide Hospital North Terrace Adelaide SA 5000
